intro: Mammillaria vetula subsp. lacostei, commonly known as the Mexican fairy duster, is a compact cactus native to Mexico. It features a short, cylindrical stem covered in white, woolly spines and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique appearance and relatively easy care make it a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
